section.title: Apache Beehive
section.p: Apache Beehive moved into the Attic in January 2010. Apache Beehive was a simple object model built on J2EE and Struts that used annotations to reduce the amount of required code.
The user mailing list, website, downloads and issue tracker all remain open, though the issue tracker is read-only. See the website at http://beehive.apache.org for more information on Beehive.
If you are looking for a project to use in place of Beehive, the following have been suggested for its components:

ul.li: Beehive NetUI / Page Flow - Struts 2 or Spring Web Flow
Beehive WSM (web service metadata) - Axis2's implementation of JSR-181

section.p: As with any project in the Attic - if you should choose to fork Beehive outside of Apache, please let us know so we can link to your project.
Archived versions of Beehive may be downloaded from the Apache Archives.
